message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.CY, cs.AI, cs.NI

The paper discusses cybersecurity threats in Critical National Infrastructures (CNI) and the need for specific security solutions. This suggests that the paper belongs to the cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) sub-category. The paper also discusses modelling and simulation of critical infrastructure systems, which falls under the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category. The use of new technologies such as the Internet of Things (IoT) and the need for effective security modelling and analysis issues suggest that the paper may also belong to the cs.CY (Computers and Society) sub-category. The use of agent-based and network-based modelling techniques suggests that the paper may also belong to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. Finally, the focus on critical infrastructure sectors such as energy and transportation suggests that the paper may also belong to the cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) sub-category.
